sentences.sContent: Avarice, embarrassment, boredom, depression, jealousy and love, for example, might epitomise the modern age.
sentences.sContent_eng: Avarice, embarrassment, boredom, depression, jealousy and love, for example, might epitomise the modern age.
sentences.sCn: 比如说，有可能象征现代的贪婪，尴尬，乏味，沮丧，嫉妒和爱等。

sentences.sContent: She was 16 when she started modelling in 1966 and by the late 80s the slender adolescent body had come to epitomise female beauty.
sentences.sContent_eng: She was 16 when she started modelling in 1966 and by the late 80s the slender adolescent body had come to epitomise female beauty.
sentences.sCn: 她在1966年16岁时开始了模特生涯。 至80年代后期，青春期男孩般纤细的身材成为女性美的象征。
